properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Alberton, Alberton West, Tarraville, Yarram.

  • There is a grassfire at Meadows Rd, Alberton
  • This fire is under control
  • This Community Information message replaces the Advice issued at 2.47pm today.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Sandy Point, Yanakie.

  • There is a bushfire at Yanakie that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have managed to stop the spread of the fire in a sensitive area and will remain on scene. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 7:04 pm on Friday 3 January.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are on scene and have stopped the spread of fire in paddocks and coastal land adjacent to Shallow Inlet.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Macarthur, Ardonachie. 

  • There is a bushfire at Lava Canal, Macarthur that is under control.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Lake Surprise and Crater Rim Walking Tracks are closed
  • Budj Bim National Park campground remains open
  • Firefighters and aircraft are working in the area
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2025 11:40 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).

Accessibility:

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Advice message is being issued for Diggora, Dingee, Drummartin, Elmore, Hunter, Kamarooka, Kamarooka East, Kamarooka North, Milloo, Neilborough, Raywood, Summerfield, Tandarra.

  • There is a grassfire at Kamarooka Store Rd, Kamarooka that is not yet under control.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 06:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook, Zumsteins, Pomonal, Moyston, includig Lake Fyans
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook, Zumsteins, Pomonal, Moyston, includig Lake Fyans .

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on January 2, 2025, at 7.30am   

Burning out operations have been undertaken to help strengthen the containment lines around the fire. An increase in smoke may be visible in nearby communities.   

The spread of the bushfire has slowed, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
 
The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted.

Hot, dry and windy conditions are forecast over the weekend, the situation can change rapidly. Stay informed and monitor the situation. 

A Total Fire Ban (TFB) has been declared for the Wimmera on Saturday, 4 January 2025.
  • Continue to monitor conditions as the situation can change rapidly.  
  •  Plan for what you will do if the situation changes
Community newsletter
Community Newsletter: Grampians National Park and Surrounds Newsletter no. 4
Tourism Newsletter - Grampians National Park and Surrounds

What you should do: 

  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings.  
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution.  
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
  • Review your fire survival plan.  
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.  
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 682. Download the Wildlife Emergency App.
  • Northern Shire Cool spaces are available at Stawell Sports and Aquatic Centre, St Arnaud swimming pool and Northern Grampian libraries 
  •  Ararat Rural City Council cool space, Alexandra oval community centre Saturday and Sunday, 10am - 5pm

Recovery and Resilience 

If you have been or may be impacted by the current bushfires, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 
 
  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present.  
  •  Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed.  
  •  Be mindful of the increased traffic, firefighting vehicles, heavy equipment  and aircraft are still working in the area
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 07:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley, Willaura, Bornes Hill and surrounds
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley, Willaura, Bornes Hill and surrounds.

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on January 2, 2025 at 7.31am.  

Burning out operations have been undertaken to help strengthen the containment lines around the fire. An increase in smoke may be visible in nearby communities.   

The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted.

Hot, dry and windy conditions are forecast over the weekend, the situation can change rapidly. Stay informed and monitor the situation. 

A Total Fire Ban (TFB) has been declared for the Wimmera on Saturday, 4 January 2025.
  • Continue to monitor conditions as the situation can change rapidly. 
  • Plan for what you will do if the situation changes.


Community newsletter
Community Newsletter: Grampians National Park and Surrounds Newsletter no. 4
Tourism Newsletter - Grampians National Park and Surrounds

What you should do: 

  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution.   
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

  •  Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed.  
  •  Be mindful of the increased traffic, firefighting vehicles, heavy equipment  and aircraft are still working in the area.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website.
    This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

    The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

    Use multiple sources to stay informed:

    • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania.
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for the eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued on January 2, 2025, at 7.30am.  

Only residents are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 

If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution.

The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted.

A Total Fire Ban (TFB) has been declared for the Wimmera on Saturday, 4 January 2025.
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

With hot, dry and windy conditions over the weekend, the situation can change rapidly. Stay informed and monitor the situation. 
Community newsletter

Community Newsletter: Grampians National Park and Surrounds Newsletter no. 4
Tourism Newsletter - Grampians National Park and Surrounds
What you should do: 
 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Plan what you would do if the situation changes. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
  • Northern Shire Cool spaces are available at Stawell Sports and Aquatic Centre, St Arnaud swimming pool and Northern Grampian libraries
  • Ararat Rural City Council cool space, Alexandra oval community centre Saturday and Sunday, 10am - 5pm

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 

  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Leave early. Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 

Recovery and Resilience 

If you have been or may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.   

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 

  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. 
  • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. 
  • Be mindful of the increased traffic, firefighting vehicles, heavy equipment  and aircraft are still working in the area.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.  

Accessibility: 

  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Threat is Reduced - Monitor Conditions Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Friday 03 January 2025, 06:59 pm Next Update: Saturday 04 January 2025, 07:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35623/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for the eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued on January 2, 2025, at 7.30am. Only residents are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution. The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted. A Total Fire Ban (TFB) has been declared for the Wimmera on Saturday, 4 January 2025. The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. With hot, dry and windy conditions over the weekend, the situation can change rapidly. Stay informed and monitor the situation.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Dumosa, Wycheproof, Wycheproof South, Bunguluke, Glenloth, Towaninny South
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Bunguluke, Dumosa, Glenloth, Towaninny South, Wycheproof, Wycheproof South .

  • There is a haystack fire at the corner of Swan Hill Donald Road & Calder Hwy, Dumosa. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities.
  • Firefighters are monitoring this fire.
  • 40 Km speed restriction signs are in place at Dumosa due to smoke across the road and reduced visibility.
  • This fire may continue to burn for the next few days.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mountain Bay, Bonnie Doon, Mansfield, Piries
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite, Bonnie Doon, Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mansfield, Mountain Bay, Piries. 

  • There is a bushfire at the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite that is under control at Highett Ridge Track.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Some tracks in the area will be closed to traffic while emergency services respond.
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 5:13 pm on Thursday 2 January.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2025 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Delatite Arm Reserve campsite
Issue Date: Friday 03 January 2025, 04:59 pm
Next Update: Monday 06 January 2025, 09:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35624/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite, Bonnie Doon, Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mansfield, Mountain Bay, Piries. 

- There is a bushfire at the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite that is under control at Highett Ridge Track.
- Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
-   Some tracks in      the area will be closed to traffic while emergency services respond.  
- This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 5:13 pm on Thursday 2 January. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
